subject: Photography
title: Henri Cartier-Bresson
description: A short lesson to help you apply Henri Cartier-Bresson.

hook.text: He never cropped, never used flash, and rarely showed his work. Yet he became photography's greatest master.

buildup.text: Henri Cartier-Bresson pioneered 'the decisive moment' â€” capturing life at the instant all elements align.

discovery.text: He used a small Leica camera and moved like a shadow, invisible to his subjects, waiting for perfection.

twist.text: Late in life, he abandoned photography entirely and returned to drawing. He said he'd said all he could with a camera.

climax.text: He co-founded Magnum Photos and defined photojournalism for half a century.

punchline.text: He didn't chase moments. He waited for them.

quiz.question: What did Cartier-Bresson do late in his career?
options: He abandoned photography and returned to drawing
